title: ISic000667. Funerary inscription for Pontius
body:
1𐆠 vixit Pontius in pa-
2ce an(nos) pl(us) m(inus) LXXX rec(essit) ·Xς K(alendas) Iun(ias)
3c(on)s(ulatu) Opilionis v(iri) c(larissimi) ind(ictione) {I}II

1𐆠VIXITPONTIUSINPA
2CEANPLMLXXXREC·XΣKIUN
3CSOPILIONISVCINDIII

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text after ISegesta L15;
  • 2: Nenci: XXX
  • 3: Nenci: Indi(ctione) II

English translation

Jonathan Prag

?((staurogram)) Pontius lived in pace more or less 80 years. He departed 16 days before the Kalends of June in the consulate of Opilio, vir clarissimus, in the second indiction.

Italian translation

((staurogramma)) Pontius è vissuto in pace più o meno ottant'anni. È morto il 24 maggio (nell'anno del) consolato del vir clarissimus Opilio, II dell'indizione

commentary

The only funerary inscription to date from Segesta, this provides important evidence for the continuity of settlement in Segesta in the sixth century CE in the period of the Gothic domination.

bibliography

    Nenci 1991 253-255 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002805 Nenci 1991 929 no.11 tav. CCCIV.2 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001413 1991.0900 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001283 De Vido 1991 980 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001409 Michelini 1999 444-445 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002305 Ampolo and Erdas 2019 L15 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001036
